Q: Flatten Nested Spark Dataframe A:

I have written a pyspark package "flatspark" to simplify the flattening process of deeply nested data. Can be installed via pypi. Repo: https://github.com/bombercorny/flatspark

Q: Adding together results from multiple workers with ignite A:

Sounds like you're describing a stream aggregation use case. Ignite can do it, easy.

While there are many ways of doing this, the canonical and the most efficient would be the following:

  1. Create a table STREAM_SUMS with the stream name as the key and the sum in the value.

  2. Use Data Streamer with Custom Receiver to write the data in.

    1. In the receiver code, read the existing value of the stream sum, add the new value, and write it back. The receiver needs to be deployed on the servers.

    2. On the client, just write your events.

How it works:

  • The client automatically batches the events and sends them in a reactive stream with backpressure. This maximizes network efficiency.

  • The client automatically routes the events to the node that stores each of the aggregates (called "partition awareness"). This ensures that there is no extra traffic between the servers.

  • The server never needs to send any data back to the client - all of the processing happens server-side in the receiver. This allows to avoid any extra traffic between the servers and the client.
